nodes.documentation:
@title Pandora Smart Contract
@author "Dr Maxim Orlovsky" <orlovsky@pandora.foundation>
 * @dev # Pandora Smart Contract
 * Main & root contract implementing the first level of Pandora Boxchain consensus
See section ["3.3. Proof of Cognitive Work (PoCW)" in Pandora white paper](https://steemit.com/cryptocurrency/%40pandoraboxchain/world-decentralized-ai-on-blockchain-with-cognitive-mining-and-open-markets-for-data-and-algorithms-pandora-boxchain)
for more details.
 * Contract token functionality is separated into a separate contract named PAN (after the name of the token)
and Pandora contracts just simply inherits PAN contract.
nodes.name: CognitiveJobManager

nodes.documentation: @dev Returns total count of active jobs
nodes.name: cognitiveJobsCount

nodes.documentation: @dev Event firing when a new cognitive job created
nodes.name: CognitiveJobCreated

nodes.documentation: @dev Event firing when a new cognitive job failed to create
nodes.name: CognitiveJobCreateFailed
isActiveJob

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct JobQueueLib.Queue storage pointer,contract IKernel,contract IDataset,uint256,address,uint256,bytes32) returns (uint256)
function (contract IWorkerNode[] memory,uint256) returns (contract IWorkerNode[] memory)
function (contract IKernel,contract IDataset,contract IWorkerNode[] memory,uint256,bytes32) returns (contract IComputingJob)

nodes.documentation:
@notice Creates and returns new cognitive job contract and starts actual cognitive work instantly
 @dev Core function creating new cognitive job contract and returning it back to the caller
nodes.name: createCognitiveJob
finishCognitiveJob

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (struct JobQueueLib.Queue storage pointer) view returns (uint256)
function (struct JobQueueLib.Queue storage pointer,uint256) view returns (bool)
function (struct JobQueueLib.Queue storage pointer) view returns (uint256)
function (struct JobQueueLib.Queue storage pointer) returns (struct JobQueueLib.QueuedJob memory,uint256)
function (contract IWorkerNode[] memory,uint256) returns (contract IWorkerNode[] memory)
function (struct JobQueueLib.QueuedJob memory,contract IWorkerNode[] memory) returns (contract IComputingJob)

nodes.name: _checkJobQueue

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (contract IKernel,contract IDataset,contract IWorkerNode[] memory,uint256,bytes32) returns (contract IComputingJob)
function (contract IKernel,contract IDataset,contract IWorkerNode[] memory,uint256,bytes32) external returns (contract CognitiveJob)

_selectWorkersWithLottery

nodes.documentation:
@notice Can"t be called by the user or other contract: for private use only
 @dev Pre-count amount of available Idle WorkerNodes. Required to allocate in-memory list of WorkerNodes.

_listIdleWorkers
